name: initDescription
displayName: Initialize - This tag sets up Amplitude on the page. You only need one Initialize tag, and it should be triggered on All Pages or a similar trigger that fires consistently on each page load.

name: trackDescription
displayName: Track Event - This tag sends an event to Amplitude. Events are actions that users take in your product, such as clicking a button, making a purchase, or signing up for an account.

name: identifyDescription
displayName: Set User Properties - This tag sets properties on the user viewing the page. For example, you could set a user property that indicates whether they're on a paid or free plan.

name: groupIdentifyDescription
displayName: Set Group Properties - See also SDK Reference. Note that group properties are indeed user properties for each member in that group. So we will use the term "user property" instead of "group property" in the "Identify Settings" section

name: setUserIdDescription
displayName: Set User Id - This tag sets the ID of the user viewing the page. Setting a user's id allows them to be tracked across devices. Trigger this tag once the user can be uniquely identified, e.g. once they login. See also SDK Reference

help: You can find the API Key by browsing to Settings for your organization in the Amplitude user interface. By creating or selecting a created project, you can find the API key for copy-pasting in the project settings. See this page for more information.
name: apiKey

help: Uncheck the box to cancel any existing opt-out for the current user. More information.
name: setOptOut
checkboxText: Opt current user out of tracking.

help: Note! You should not set the session ID manually unless you know exactly what you are doing. More information.

valueValidators.errorMessage: You must provide the session ID as a UNIX timestamp (milliseconds since Jan 1, 1970).

name: setSessionId

help: Leave empty to reset the User ID (sets it to undefined). More information.
name: setUserId

subParams.help: Add a single group name (e.g. 15) or a comma-separated list (e.g. 2,12,24) of group names.
subParams.name: groupName

help: Set the Device ID for the current user. Warning! This is not recommended unless you know what you are doing. More information.

valueValidators.errorMessage: The device ID should be an alphanumeric string. You can't use the period (".") in the ID string.

name: setDeviceId

subParams.name: eventPropertiesObject
subParams.help: Select a GTM variable that returns a valid event properties object. This overwrites the event properties in Individual Event Properties if there are any duplicate keys. Amplitude ignores any inputs not in the object format and any value under user_properties key. Click here for an example.
subParams.notSetText: Don't set an Event Property Object

subParams.help: Add a custom timestamp in UNIX time (milliseconds). Leave empty to use current time.

valueValidators.errorMessage: You need to provide a UNIX timestamp in milliseconds.

subParams.name: trackTimestamp

subParams.help:
Choose a GTM variable that returns an object with the following keys:
  • productId (required)
  • price (required)
  • quantity
  • revenueType
  • eventProperties
More information.
subParams.name: revenueFromVariable
subParams.checkboxText: Load Revenue object from a GTM variable

valueValidators.errorMessage: Enter price as a number with decimals separated by a period (e.g. 15.99).
Enter price as a number with decimals separated by a period (e.g. 15.99).

subParams.help: Add a single group name (e.g. 15). Comma-separated list of multiple group names is not supported.
subParams.name: identifyGroupName

subParams.displayName:
Add individual user property operations each as its own row in the table. You can add as many as you like, but note that you can only include a specific User Property in a single operation. The operations are executed in order. More information.
Please note that a hardcoded value in the `Value` field will always convert an input into a string. If you want to use other types, please create a GTM variable, specifically a Data Layer Variable. This will accurately capture the types you've specified.
subParams.name: identifyLabel
userPropertyOperationsObject
subParams.help: Select a GTM variable that returns a valid User Properties object to set multiple user properties at once. Only the values nested under the `user_properties` key are considered for the user properties. This bulk operation only supports the `set` operation. This overwrites the Individual operation user properties if there are any duplicate keys. Click here for an example.
subParams.notSetText: Don't set an User Properties Object

subParams.help: Check this box to enable autocapture. Read more.
subParams.name: defaultEventTracking
detAttribution
attributionInitialEmptyValue
subParams.help: By default, initial direct visits are tagged with the "EMPTY" campaign value. You can add a different initial empty value into this field. Read more.

subParams.name: attributionExcludeReferrers
subParams.help: Pass a comma-separated list of referring domains you want to exclude from campaign attribution. Each one of them performs exact match. For regex, use "Exclude Referrers Regex" instead. Read more.

subParams.name: attributionExcludeReferrersRegex
subParams.help: Pass a comma-separated list of referring domains you want to exclude from campaign attribution. Each one of them is converted to a Regex object and performs regex match. Read more.

subParams.name: attributionResetSession
subParams.checkboxText: Reset the session on a new campaign

subParams.help: Check this box to enable attribution tracking. Read more.

subParams.name: detPageView
pageViewLegacy
subParams.checkboxText: Use the legacy page view properties
subParams.help: Enable this to use legacy page view event type (Page View) and event properties (page_location, page_path, page_title, page_url). By default it will use the `Page View Type` input as the event type and [Amplitude] Page Domain, [Amplitude] Page Location, [Amplitude] Page Path, [Amplitude] Page Title. [Amplitude] Page URL as the event properties for the page view event.

subParams.name: pageViewType
subParams.help: The event type for page view event. The default value has been change from Page View to [Amplitude] Page Viewed.

subParams.name: pageHistoryTracking
subParams.help: Provides advanced control for single page application on when page views are tracked. Read more.
Check this box to enable page views tracking. Read more.

subParams.name: detSession
subParams.help: Check this box to enable session tracking. Read more.

subParams.name: detFormInteraction
subParams.help: Check this box to enable form interaction tracking. Read more.

subParams.name: detFileDownload
subParams.help: Check this box to enable file download tracking. Read more.

subParams.name: autocaptureElementInteractions
subParams.help: Check this box to enable element interactions tracking. Read more.

subParams.name: elementInteractionsCssSelectorAllowlist
subParams.help: Accepts one or more CSS selectors that define which elements on the page should always be tracked. Read more.

subParams.name: elementInteractionsActionClickAllowlist
subParams.help: Accepts one or more CSS selectors that define which elements on the page should always be tracked. Read more.

subParams.name: elementInteractionsPageUrlAllowlistString
subParams.help: Defines the URL, URLs, or URL pattern on which Amplitude tracks element click and change events. For regex, use "Page Url Allowlist Regex" instead. Read more.

subParams.name: elementInteractionsPageUrlAllowlistRegex
subParams.help: Defines the URL, URLs, or URL pattern on which Amplitude tracks element click and change events. Each one of them is converted to a Regex object and performs regex match. Read more.

subParams.name: elementInteractionsDataAttributePrefixString
subParams.help: Allows the SDK to capture data attributes as an event property. For regex, use "Data Attribute Prefix Regex" instead. Read more.

subParams.name: elementInteractionsDataAttributePrefixRegex
subParams.help: Allows the SDK to capture data attributes as an event property. Each one of them is converted to a Regex object and performs regex match. Read more.

subParams.name: autocaptureNetworkTracking
subParams.help: Check this box to enable element interactions tracking. Read more.

subParams.name: networkTrackingIgnoreAmplitudeRequests
subParams.checkboxText: Ignore requests made to Amplitude API's

subParams.name: networkTrackingIgnoreHosts
subParams.displayName: List of hosts to ignore requests from (comma separated)

subParams.name: networkTrackingCaptureRules
subParams.displayName: The rules for capturing network requests

param.name: urls
param.help: Define list of URLs to capture (exact match). By default any URL is captured. (comma separated list).

param.name: methods
param.help: The HTTP methods to capture. e.g.: ["POST", "PUT", "DELETE"]

param.name: statusCodeRange
param.help: The status code range to capture. Supports comma-separated ranges or single status codes. For example, "0,200-299,413,500-599"

param.name: urlsRegex
param.help: Define list of URL regex patterns to capture. By default any URL is captured. (comma separated list).

subParams.help: Configure Amplitude to use EU Data Residency server zone. Read more here.
subParams.name: euData

subParams.help: If you want, you can initialize the instance with a User ID, if already available. You can also use the setUserId command to initialize the User ID at a later time. For more details, see this page.
subParams.name: initUserId

subParams.help:
If you select Use default values, then the initialization is done with the default values.

You can also select a {{GTM variable}} from the list, which needs to return an object that has the key-value pairs you want to configure the instance with. You can find the key-value pairs following this example.

Finally, you can Set configuration manually in the tag itself, by selecting the corresponding option.
subParams.name: initOptions
initTrackingOptions
subParams.help: By default, the SDK tracks these properties automatically. You can override this behavior by setting the corresponding options to "false".
Wether to use client side user agent enrichment. Enable client side user agent to make the changes compatible with previous GTM template version.
subParams.name: userAgentEnrichment
subParams.checkboxText: (Legacy) Enable client side user agent enrichment

subParams.name: osName
subParams.checkboxText: Enrich os_name using client user agent enrichment

subParams.name: osVersion
subParams.checkboxText: Enrich os_version using client user agent enrichment

subParams.name: deviceManufacturer
subParams.checkboxText: Enrich device_manufacturer using client user agent enrichment

subParams.name: deviceModel
subParams.checkboxText: Enrich device_model using client user agent enrichment

subParams.name: instanceName
subParams.help: If you want to run more than one Amplitude instance (with different API keys or different initialization options), you can provide an Instance Name here. Make sure that all the Amplitude tags that should reference this instance have the Instance Name configured in the tag settings.
